edu.upenn.eas499.aimtd
Class Monster

java.lang.Object
  edu.upenn.eas499.aimtd.Monster

public abstract class Monster
extends java.lang.Object

Monster that travels the TD map in order to reach an objective.

Author:
fedenusy

Constructor Detail

Monster

public Monster(int x,
               int y,
               int hp,
               int moveSpeed,
               int intelligenceLevel)
Parameters:
x - The monster's initial x-position.
y - The monster's initial y-position.
hp - The monster's remaining total health points.
moveSpeed - The monster's movement speed. A speed of 100 means that the monster can move a Euclidean distance of 1 within a single tick. Thus, if the monster's initial position is (1,0), its moveSpeed is 200, and the Coordinator decides that the monster should move East, after calling Coordinator.tick() the Monster will be located at (3,0).
intelligenceLevel - The Monster's intelligence level, which defines Monster movement patterns:
Intelligence level 1: The monster will move towards the closest objective.
Intelligence level 2: The monster will follow the path towards the objective that's least likely to get the monster killed.
Intelligence level 3: An improvement on intelligence level 2, where the Monster makes group decisions in conjunction with other nearby level 3 Monsters in order to increase the team's likelihood of reaching an objective.

addWaypoint

public void addWaypoint(int x,
                        int y)
Adds a waypoint to the Monster's path. Monsters will try to reach waypoints in the order they were added before attempting to reach any of the objective coordinates on the Map. If the waypoints are reachable, waypoint coordinates will be treated as if they were objectives - in other words, the Monster will use its corresponding intelligence level's movement patterns to reach each waypoint before trying to reach any of the objective coordinates on the map.

Parameters:
x - The waypoint's x-coordinate.
y - The waypoint's y-coordinate.

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Whether this Monster's HP is greater than 0.

Returns:
Whether this monster still lives.

damage

public void damage(int dmg)
Convenience method that decreases this Monster's HP by a determined amount.

Parameters:
dmg - The amount this monster's hit points should decrease by.
